objectives.desc: Define the AWS Cloud and its value proposition

subtopics.desc: Define the benefits of the AWS cloud
Explain how the AWS cloud allows users to focus on business value

details.desc: Shifting technical resources to revenue-generating activities as opposed to managing infrastructure

objectives.desc: Identify aspects of AWS Cloud economics

subtopics.desc: Define items that would be part of a Total Cost of Ownership proposal

details.desc: Understand the role of operational expenses (OpEx)
Understand the role of capital expenses (CapEx)
Understand labor costs associated with on-premises operations
Understand the impact of software licensing costs when moving to the cloud

subtopics.desc: Identify which operations will reduce costs by moving to the cloud

details.desc: Managed services (for example, RDS, ECS, EKS, DynamoDB)

objectives.desc: Explain the different cloud architecture design principles

subtopics.desc: Explain the design principles

details.desc: Implement elasticity in the cloud versus on-premises

objectives.desc: Define the AWS shared responsibility model

subtopics.desc: Recognize the elements of the Shared Responsibility Model
Describe the customer's responsibly on AWS

details.desc: Describe how the customerâ€™s responsibilities may shift depending on the service used(for example with RDS, Lambda, or EC2)

subtopics.desc: Describe AWS responsibilities

objectives.desc: Define AWS Cloud security and compliance concepts

subtopics.desc: Identify where to find AWS compliance information

details.desc: Locations of lists of recognized available compliance controls ie HIPPA SOCs
Recognize that compliance requirements vary among AWS services

subtopics.desc: At a high level, describe how customers achieve compliance on AWS

details.desc: Identify different encryption options on AWS (for example, In transit, At rest)

subtopics.desc: Describe who enables encryption on AWS for a given service

details.desc: Recognize that logs exist for auditing and monitoring (do not have to understand the logs)
Define Amazon CloudWatch, AWS Config, and AWS CloudTrail

subtopics.desc: Explain the concept of least privileged access
Understand the purpose of User and Identity Management

details.desc: Access keys and password policies (rotation, complexity)
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) Groups, Users, Roles, Policies
Tasks that require use of root accounts Protection of root accounts

subtopics.desc: Recognize there are different network security capabilities

details.desc: Native AWS services (for example, security groups, Network ACLs, AWS WAF)
3rd party security products from the AWS Marketplace

subtopics.desc: Recognize there is documentation and where to find it (for example, best practices, whitepapers, official documents)

details.desc: AWS Knowledge Center, Security Center, security forum, and security blogs
Managed services (for example, RDS, ECS, EKS, DynamoDB)

subtopics.desc: Know that security checks are a component of AWS Trusted Advisor

objectives.desc: Define methods of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud

subtopics.desc: Identify at a high level different ways of provisioning and operating in the AWS cloud

details.desc: Programmatic access, APIs, SDKs, AWS Management Console, CLI, Infrastructure as Code

subtopics.desc: Identify different types of cloud deployment models
Identify connectivity options
Describe the relationships among Regions, Availability Zones, and Edge Locations
Describe how to achieve high availability through the use of multiple Availability Zones

details.desc: Recall that high availability is achieved by using multiple Availability Zones
Recognize that Availability Zones do not share single points of failure

subtopics.desc: Describe when to consider the use of multiple AWS Regions
Describe at a high level the benefits of Edge Locations
Describe the categories of services on AWS (compute, storage, network, database)
Identify AWS compute services

details.desc: Recognize there are different compute families
Recognize the different services that provide compute (for example, AWS Lambda compared to Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS), or Amazon EC2, etc.)
Recognize that elasticity is achieved through Auto Scaling
Identify the purpose of load balancers

subtopics.desc: Identify different AWS storage services

details.desc: Describe Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)
Describe Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)

subtopics.desc: Describe at a high level the benefits of Edge Locations

details.desc: Identify the purpose of Amazon Route 53

subtopics.desc: Identify different AWS database services

details.desc: Install databases on Amazon EC2 compared to AWS managed databases

subtopics.desc: Recognize there is documentation (best practices, whitepapers, AWS Knowledge Center, forums, blogs)
Identify the various levels and scope of AWS support

Identify sources of AWS technical assistance and knowledge including professional services,solution architects, training and certification, and the Amazon Partner Network

objectives.desc: Compare and contrast the various pricing models for AWS (for example, On-Demand Instances, Reserved Instances, and Spot Instance pricing)

Identify scenarios/best fit for Reserved-Instance pricing

subtopics.desc: Identify scenarios/best fit for Spot Instance pricing
Identify scenarios/best fit for Dedicated Instance pricing

objectives.desc: Recognize the various account structures in relation to AWS billing and pricing

objectives.desc: Identify resources available for billing support
